page.title: 17Marwell Zoological Park 3.
page.content: The Park covers 100 acres and at the end of 1984 contained 534 mammals(75 species)and 231 birds(52species).The mammals include Carnivores,Rodents, Ungulates,Primates and Marsupials. The Zoo specialises in breeding Deer, Antelope,Zebra,Wild Horse,Wild Cattle and big Cats.It holds the largest and most productive herds in the world of two species -the Scimitar-horned Oryx from the southern Sahara and Przewalski's Horse from East Asia. In both cases the aim is to return animals bred in captivity to the wild. The Przewalcki's Horse is the only true wild horse still alive and is of major genetic importance.It is almost certainly extinct in the wild and specimens from Marwell will be re-introduced into East Asia in the near future.
